required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of MK0594 to Treat Overactive Bladder (0594-003)
clinical_study.official_title: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Placebo- and Active-Controlled, Parallel-Group, Dose-Ranging Study of MK0594 in Patients With Overactive Bladder

brief_summary.textblock: This study is designed to investigate whether a new drug may offer safe and effective treatment for patients with overactive bladder.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in baseline in average daily micturitions as recorded on patient voiding diaries.
primary_outcome.description: Change in baseline in average daily micturitions as recorded on patient voiding diaries.

secondary_outcome.measure: Average daily strong urgency, total incontinence, and Urge UI episodes from voiding diaries.
secondary_outcome.description: Average daily strong urgency, total incontinence, and Urge UI episodes from voiding diaries.

secondary_outcome.measure: Global assessment of improvement in UI, perception of urgency, and bother of UI symptoms.
secondary_outcome.description: Global assessment of improvement in UI, perception of urgency, and bother of UI

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with predominantly urge incontinence overactive bladder episodes
- Patients must meet minimum eligibility requirements (e.g., average number of micturitions/day) based on screening diary cards
Exclusion Criteria:
- History of Diabetes insipidus, uncontrolled hyperglycemia or hypercalcemia
- Lower urinary tract symptoms associated with benign prostatic hypertrophy
- Active or current Urinary Tract Infections (UTIs)
- Surgery to correct prolapsed uterus or stress incontinence
